revision.comment: move lang= to 1= in {{IPA}} (2); move lang= to 1= in {{audio}}
revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{suffix|en|yearning|ly}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|RP}} {{IPA|en|/ˈjɜːnɪŋli/}} * {{a|US}} {{enPR|yûrnʹing-lē}}, {{IPA|en|/ˈjɝnɪŋli/}} * {{audio|en|en-us-yearningly.ogg|Audio (US)}} ===Adverb=== {{en-adv}} # With [[yearning]]; with [[desire]]; [[longingly]]. #* '''1860''', {{w|George Eliot}}, ''{{w|The Mill on the Floss}}'', Book 6, Chapter 14,<sup>[http://www.gutenberg.org/files/6688/6688-h/6688-h.htm]</sup> #*: He was silent a few moments, not looking at her; while her eyes were turned toward him '''yearningly''', in alarm at this sudden change. #* '''1904''', {{w|Henry James}}, ''{{w|The Golden Bowl}}'', Part 2, Chapter 7,<sup>[http://www.gutenberg.org/files/4264/4264-h/4264-h.htm]</sup> #*: Yet what was it she had in mind, what did she wish to make of him beyond what she had already made, a patient, punctilious host, mindful that she had originally arrived much as a stranger, arrived not at all deliberately or '''yearningly''' invited?—so that one positively had her possible susceptibilities the MORE on one’s conscience. #* '''1944''', {{w|Emily Carr}}, ''{{w|The House of All Sorts}}'', “Life Loves Living,” [http://www.gutenberg.net.au/ebooks01/0100121h.html] #*: The old maple stump shot sickly pink switches from her roots, new switches every year. They crept '''yearningly''' toward the little square of window.
